20101223020029.000|20101223020030.000|CC1|MESS AND THERE IS A LOT OF WORK 
20101223020030.000|20101223020031.000|CC1|LEFT TO DO.                     
20101223020031.000|20101223020032.000|CC1|OVERNIGHT THE STREETS OF        
20101223020032.000|20101223020034.000|CC1|DOWNTOWN LAGUNA BEACH WERE UNDER
20101223020034.000|20101223020035.000|CC1|TWO TO THREE FEET OF RUSHING    
20101223020035.000|20101223020036.000|CC1|WATER.                          
20101223020036.000|20101223020037.000|CC1|THE STORM DRAINS WERE           
20101223020037.000|20101223020038.000|CC1|OVERWHELMED AND THAT IS WHAT    
20101223020038.000|20101223020039.000|CC1|CAUSED ALL OF THIS.

20101223020041.000|20101223020042.000|CC1|MUD HAD TO BE REMOVED FROM THE  
20101223020042.000|20101223020044.000|CC1|STREETS AND SHOPS.              
20101223020044.000|20101223020045.000|CC1|DEREK TURNER WAS HOPING THE     
20101223020045.000|20101223020047.000|CC1|DAMAGE TO HIS STORE WASN'T TOO  
20101223020047.000|20101223020047.000|CC1|SEVERE.                         
20101223020047.000|20101223020049.000|CC1|>> I EXPECTED IT TO HOLD UP.    
20101223020049.000|20101223020050.000|CC1|IT'S A PRETTY NEW SHOP.

20101223020053.000|20101223020056.000|CC1|TWO INCHES OF WATER THROUGHOUT

20101223020059.000|20101223020100.000|CC1|PAST HOUR, HOUR AND A HALF.     
20101223020100.000|20101223020101.000|CC1|>> Reporter: EARLY THIS MORNING 
20101223020101.000|20101223020103.000|CC1|IS WHEN LAGUNA BEACH POLICE     
20101223020103.000|20101223020105.000|CC1|STARTED GETTING 911 CALLS FROM  
20101223020105.000|20101223020106.000|CC1|PEOPLE LIVING ALONG LAGUNA      
20101223020106.000|20101223020107.000|CC1|CANYON ROAD TELLING THEM THAT   
20101223020107.000|20101223020108.000|CC1|THEY NEEDED HELP.               
20101223020108.000|20101223020109.000|CC1|>> ABOUT 2:15 THIS MORNING WE   
20101223020109.000|20101223020110.000|CC1|GOT OUR FIRST CALL.

20101223020115.000|20101223020116.000|CC1|QUITE A DELUGE.

20101223020127.000|20101223020128.000|CC1|THEN ON.

20101223020129.000|20101223020130.000|CC1|MADE 24 RESCUES THIS MORNING.

20101223020132.000|20101223020133.000|CC1|LEAVE THEY STARTED CLEANING UP

20101223020135.000|20101223020137.000|CC1|>> I CAME OUT HERE LAST IN IT

20101223020309.000|20101223020311.000|CC1|50 MILES PER HOUR WHICH MAKES IT
20101223020311.000|20101223020314.000|CC1|EXTREMELY DANGEROUS.

20101223020315.000|20101223020316.000|CC1|HIGH THE FAST-MOVING WATER

20101223020329.000|20101223020330.000|CC1|400 FAMILIES AND 75 BUSINESSES

20101223020340.000|20101223020342.000|CC1|THEY TRIED TO GET AROUND

20101223020612.000|20101223020613.000|CC1|WITH MUD.

20101223020614.000|20101223020616.000|CC1|MUD HAS FORCED SOME PEOPLE OUT  
20101223020616.000|20101223020617.000|CC1|OF THEIR HOMES.                 
20101223020617.000|20101223020619.000|CC1|ROB MCMILLAN IS LIVE IN HIGHLAND
20101223020619.000|20101223020620.000|CC1|TO SHOW US WHAT MAKES IT ONE OF 
20101223020620.000|20101223020623.000|CC1|THE HARD HE HIT CITIES BY THE   
20101223020623.000|20101223020624.000|CC1|STORM.                          
20101223020624.000|20101223020625.000|CC1|>> Reporter: YOU'RE ABSOLUTELY  
20101223020625.000|20101223020627.000|CC1|RIGHT THIS IS ONE OF THE HARDEST
20101223020627.000|20101223020628.000|CC1|HIT CITIES IN THE INLAND EMPIRE.
20101223020628.000|20101223020630.000|CC1|THE RAIN CONTINUES TO FALL.     
20101223020630.000|20101223020636.000|CC1|200 HOMES ARE UNDERMANNED TORREY
20101223020636.000|20101223020637.000|CC1|EVACUATIONS BECAUSE OF TREUT OF 
20101223020637.000|20101223020637.000|CC1|MUDSLIDES.
